FuncDef:
The loss-measure dual-ended continual command enables dual-ended frame loss measurement of Y.1731.
The undo loss-measure dual-ended continual command disables dual-ended frame loss measurement of Y.1731.
By default, dual-ended frame loss measurement of Y.1731 is not enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a test instance.
The value is an integer of 1 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The dual-ended frame loss measurement function of Y.1731 is service-oriented. Then, you can estimate quality of services (QoSs) based on the calculated packet loss ratio.
Prerequisites
Before you run the flow-name loss-measure dual-ended continual command, ensure that the following configurations are complete:
IEEE Standard 802.1ag-2007 of CFM has been specified using the cfm version standard command in the system view.The CFM function has been enabled globally using the cfm enable (system view) command in the system view.An MD has been created using the cfm md command in the system view.An MA has been created using the ma command in the MD view.An inward-facing MEP has been created using the mep mep-id command in the MA view.A remote MEP in the MA has been created using the remote-mep command in the MA view.The local MEP in the MA has been enabled to send CCMs using the mep ccm-send enable command in the MA view.The local MEP has been enabled to receive CCMs from the remote MEP in the same MA using the remote-mep ccm-receive enable command in the MA view.The test instance has been created using the test-id command in the MA view.
